oracle.cloud.storage
Interface CloudStorage

All Known Subinterfaces:
EncryptedCloudStorage
All Known Implementing Classes:
CloudStorageImpl, EncryptedCloudStorageImpl, MockStorageImpl
public interface CloudStorage

The CloudStorage interface defines methods that allow users to manage data within a Service Instance of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service. Users can only execute operations that are permitted by their security roles and permissions. 

 CloudStorageConfig myConfig = new CloudStorageConfig();
 myConfig.setServiceName("myService-myIdentityDomain")
   .setUsername("myUsername")
   .setPassword("myPassword".toCharArray())
   .setServiceUrl("https://storage.us1.oraclecloud.com");
 CloudStorage myConnection = CloudStorageFactory.getStorage(myConfig);
 FileInputStream fis = new FileInputStream("hello_world.txt");
 myConnection.storeObject("My Container", "hello_world.txt", "text/plain", fis);

Author:
Copyright (c) 2013, Oracle and/or its affiliates. All rights reserved.

listContainers

java.util.List<Container> listContainers()
List the Containers owned by this Service instance. Note that this is limited to the first 10,000 entries. For additional Containers, use query options.

Returns:
list of Containers

                                 AclType type)

Parameters:

type - the type of ACL to retrieve
Returns:
the current ACL string

setContainerAcl

void setContainerAcl(java.lang.String name,
                     AclType type,
                     java.lang.String aclvalue)
Set the ACL specification for a Container. For type, please refer to AclType. aclvalue will have the following format: .r:[-]value value can be * to specify any referrer host is allowed access. The leading minus sign - indicates referrer hosts that should be denied access. Example valid ACLs: .r:* // Allow access to any referrer host. .r:*,.r:-.thief.com // Allow access to any referrer host except that ends with thief.com .r:*,.r:.example.com,.r:-thief.example.com

Parameters:
name - the name of the Container
type - the type of ACL to set
aclvalue - the new value for this ACL

listObjects

java.util.List<Key> listObjects(java.lang.String container,
                                java.util.Map<QueryOption,java.lang.String> options)
List the Objects stored within a Container. A maximum of 10,000 results will be returned. For additional results, use query options.

Parameters:

options - query options (may be null)
Returns:
list of Object keys

listObjectsByPath

                              java.lang.String delimiter,
                              java.lang.String path,
                              java.util.Map<QueryOption,java.lang.String> options)

Parameters:
container - the name of the Container
delimiter - the path delimiter (e.g. "/")
path - the name of the path to search
options - query options (may be null)
Returns:
list of matching Object keys and paths

storeObjectManifest

Key storeObjectManifest(java.lang.String container,
                        java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String contentType,
                        java.lang.String segment_container,
                        java.lang.String segment_prefix)
Create or overwrite an Object manifest file within a Container

Parameters:
container - the name of the Container
key - the Object key
contentType - the media type of the stored content
segment_container - the name of the Container holding the Object segments
segment_prefix - common prefix for all the segments
Returns:
Object key reference

storeObjectManifest

Key storeObjectManifest(java.lang.String container,
                        java.lang.String key,
                        java.lang.String contentType,
                        java.lang.String segment_container,
                        java.lang.String segment_prefix,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> customMetadata)
Create or overwrite an Object manifest file (with custom metadata) within a Container OPC storage service has a limit of 5GB on the size of a single uploaded Object. However, the download size of a single Object is virtually unlimited with the concept of segmentation. Segments of the larger Object are uploaded and then a special manifest file is created that, when downloaded, sends all the segments concatenated as a single Object. All the Object segments need to be in the same container, have a common Object name prefix, and their names sort in the order they should be concatenated. They donât have to be in the same container as the manifest file will be, which is useful to keep container listings clean. The manifest file is simply a zero-byte file. segment_container is the container the Object segments are in and segment_prefix is the common prefix for all the segments. Please refer to Large Object Support of OpenStack Swift documentation for more explanation of segments.

Parameters:
container - the name of the Container
key - the Object key
contentType - the media type of the stored content
segment_container - the name of the Container holding the Object segments
segment_prefix - common prefix for all the segments
customMetadata - a map Object of metadata key/value pairs for the Object being stored
Returns:
Object key reference

retrieveObject

StorageInputStream retrieveObject(java.lang.String container,
                                  java.lang.String key)
Retrieve an Object from a Container.

Parameters:
container - the Container name
key - the Object key
Returns:
Object data as an InputStream

retrieveObject

StorageInputStream retrieveObject(java.lang.String container,
                                  java.lang.String key,
                                  ContentRange... ranges)
Retrieve specific ranges of bytes from an Object in a Container. This method cannot be called on an encrypted connection. Passing a null range or an empty array of ranges will retrieve the entire Object. Returned StorageInputStream contains Object data and metadata.

Parameters:
container - the Container name
key - the Object key
ranges - one or more byte ranges to retrieve
Returns:
StorageInputStream

isEncrypted

boolean isEncrypted(java.lang.String container,
                    java.lang.String key)
Determine whether an Object has been encrypted.

Parameters:
container - the Container name
key - the Object key
Returns:
true if the content of the Object referred by the given key in the given container has been encrypted.
